page.title: 05 Church and School
page.content: { Long Bennington}has a church called {St.Swithuns}and a{Methodist Chapel. The old school, which was pulled down in February 1984, was built in{1847 and the teacher's house in{1849,}on land given by{George Grote Esq.}The new school is constructed of red brick and has a pantiled roof. It has five classrooms, a large well-equipped hall, art and craft areas and a kiln room. The{150 children}come from{Long {Bennington, Westborough}and the surrounding countryside. {Life in Long Bennington:}At 7.00am. the alarm on my clock radio went off. I jumped out of bed, my two brothers and my sister had already eaten their breakfast, I breakfasted alone. After washing and dressing I helped my Mum get my sister ready for Playschool. It took my two brothers and I fifteen minutes to walk a mile to school.
